org.sd.util.tree
Class Tree<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.util.tree.Tree<T>

public class Tree<T>
extends java.lang.Object

A tree data structure.

This class maintains the tree structure while providing for data of type T to be stored in each node.

Author:
Spence Koehler

public boolean isAncestor(Tree<T> other)
Determine whether this node is an ancestor of the other.

Note that a node is not its own ancestor.

Parameters:
other - The other node.
Returns:
true if this node is an ancestor of other.

treesAtDepth

public java.util.List<Tree<T>> treesAtDepth(int depth)
Return all trees at the given depth (0-based) from this node, where this node is depth 0, its children are depth 1, and so on.

Returns:
the nodes at the specified depth (possibly empty, but not null).

maxDepth

public int maxDepth()
Compute (1+) the maximum depth of nodes under this tree (0-based).

The depth of a tree with no children is 1; etc.

numLeaves

public int numLeaves()
Compute the number of leaf nodes in this tree.

If this tree is a leaf itself(has no children) the number of leaves is 1

Prune this node's children from the tree.

Note: each child's "parent" will still point to this node. Fix them if needed.

Returns:
the pruned children.
